generated_description:
**Hermes Robotics** is an innovative company based in San Francisco that specializes in providing autonomous street sweeping solutions. Their mission is straightforward yet impactful: to retrofit existing vehicles, allowing them to operate autonomously at low speeds. This approach not only enhances urban cleanliness but also promotes sustainability by maximizing the use of current vehicle fleets.

Founded as a part of the **Y Combinator Batch W21**, Hermes Robotics has cultivated a small but dedicated team of 5 employees. Their group partner, Nicolas Dessaigne, brings a wealth of experience to guide the team in this ambitious endeavor.

Hermes positions itself within several niches, tagged as 'autonomous-trucking', 'hard-tech', 'robotics', and 'San Francisco Bay Area'. This diversity reflects their broad vision of pushing the boundaries of robotics technology in practical applications.

One of their standout offerings is the **Autonomy Retrofit Kit**, which enables any vehicle, anywhere, to become autonomous. This kit is engineered specifically for low-speed operations, making it an ideal solution for street cleaning.

For more information, or to explore their services, you can visit [Hermes Robotics](http://hermes-robotics.com). They are approachable and eager to connect, as indicated by their contact email: contact@hermes-robotics.com. 

In summary, Hermes Robotics is at the forefront of a valuable fusion of technology and utility, turning ordinary vehicles into smart, autonomous street cleaners and paving the way for cleaner, more efficient urban spaces.
